alert.note: Alert for Avoyelles; St. Landry (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 10:01AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Avoyelles and north central St. Landry Parishes through 1030 AM CDT... At 1001 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Big Bend, or 10 miles northeast of Bordelonville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marksville, Simmesport, Moreauville, Bordelonville, Morrow, Cottonport, Mansura, Hessmer, Evergreen, Plaucheville, Goudeau, Lake Ophelia National Wildlife Refuge, Dupont, Big Bend and Hamburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
